Chapter 2 Linear regression 2.1 Introduction 2.2 Least Squares Linear Regression

Chapter 2 Linear regression 2.1 Introduction Linear regression predicts a real-valued output \(y \in \mathbb{R}\) given input \(x \in \mathbb{R}^D\). Key property: \(E[y|x] = w^Tx\). 2.2 Least Squares Linear Regression 2.2.1 Terminology Model: \(p(y|x, \theta) = \mathcal{N}(y|w_0 + w^Tx, \sigma^2)\) Parameters: \(\theta = (w_0, w, \sigma^2)\) \(w_0\): Offset/bias term. \(w\): Weights or regression coefficients. 2.2.2 Least Squares Estimation Objective: Minimize negative log-likelihood. Residual Sum of Squares (RSS): \(RSS(w) = \frac{1}{2} \sum_{n=1}^{N} (y_n - w^Tx_n)^2\)
